sn37.5:1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā anuruddho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn37.5:1.1.eng: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn37.5:1.2.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhante, mātugāmaṃ passāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjantaṃ.
sn37.5:1.2.eng: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that a lady—when her body breaks up, after death—is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn37.5:1.3.pli: Katīhi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti?
sn37.5:1.3.eng: How many qualities do ladies have so that they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”

sn37.5:2.1.pli: “Pañcahi kho, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
sn37.5:2.1.eng: “Anuruddha, when ladies have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

sn37.5:2.3.pli: Assaddho ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca hoti, kodhano ca hoti, duppañño ca hoti—
sn37.5:2.3.eng: They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, irritable, and witless.

sn37.5:2.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti.
sn37.5:2.4.eng: When ladies possess these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

sn37.6:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.

sn37.6:1.3.pli: Assaddho ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca hoti, upanāhī ca hoti, duppañño ca hoti—
sn37.6:1.3.eng: “… They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, acrimonious, and witless. …”

sn37.6:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti.

sn37.7:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.

sn37.7:1.3.pli: Assaddho ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca hoti, issukī ca hoti, duppañño ca hoti—
sn37.7:1.3.eng: “… They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, jealous, and witless. …”

sn37.7:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjatī”ti.

sn37.8:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.

sn37.8:1.3.pli: Assaddho ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca hoti, maccharī ca hoti, duppañño ca hoti—
sn37.8:1.3.eng: “… They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, stingy, and witless. …”

sn37.8:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo …pe…

sn37.9:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, anuruddha, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo …pe… apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.

sn37.9:1.3.pli: Assaddho ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca hoti, aticārī ca hoti, duppañño ca hoti—
sn37.9:1.3.eng: “… They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, adulterous, and witless. …”

sn37.9:1.4.pli: imehi kho, anuruddha, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo …pe… upapajjatī”ti.

sn38.1:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā sāriputto magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake.
sn38.1:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.

sn38.1:1.2.pli: Atha kho jambukhādako paribbājako yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn38.1:1.2.eng: Then the wanderer Jambukhādaka went up to Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.

sn38.1:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho jambukhādako paribbājako āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
sn38.1:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Sāriputta:

sn38.1:2.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.

sn38.1:2.3.eng: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion

sn38.1:2.5.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
sn38.1:2.5.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”

sn38.1:2.6.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

sn38.1:2.7.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?

sn38.1:2.8.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṃ—
sn38.1:2.8.eng: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

sn38.1:2.9.pli: sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sn38.1:2.9.eng: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

sn38.1:2.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
sn38.1:2.10.eng: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”

sn38.1:2.11.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.
sn38.1:2.11.eng: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.

sn38.1:2.12.eng: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”

sn38.10:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘craving’.

sn38.10:1.4.eng: Craving for sensual pleasures, craving for existence, and craving for nonexistence.

sn38.10:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṃ taṇhānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?
sn38.10:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these cravings?”

sn38.10:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṃ taṇhānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.10:1.8.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etāsaṃ taṇhānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?

sn38.10:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etāsaṃ taṇhānaṃ pahānāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.10:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etāsaṃ taṇhānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.10:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etāsaṃ taṇhānaṃ pahānāya.

sn38.11:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘a flood’.

sn38.11:1.4.eng: The floods of sensuality, desire to be reborn, views, and ignorance.

sn38.11:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etesaṃ oghānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?
sn38.11:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these floods?”

sn38.11:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etesaṃ oghānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.11:1.8.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etesaṃ oghānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?

sn38.11:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etesaṃ oghānaṃ pahānāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.11:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etesaṃ oghānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.11:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etesaṃ oghānaṃ pahānāya.

sn38.12:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘grasping’.

sn38.12:1.3.eng: “Reverend, there are these four kinds of grasping.

sn38.12:1.4.eng: Grasping at sensual pleasures, views, precepts and observances, and theories of a self.

sn38.12:1.5.eng: These are the four kinds of grasping.”

sn38.12:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etesaṃ upādānānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?
sn38.12:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these four kinds of grasping?”

sn38.12:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etesaṃ upādānānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.12:1.8.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etesaṃ upādānānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?

sn38.12:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etesaṃ upādānānaṃ pahānāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.12:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etesaṃ upādānānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.12:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etesaṃ upādānānaṃ pahānāya.

sn38.13:0.3.eng: A Question About States of Existence

sn38.13:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of these things called ‘states of existence’.

sn38.13:1.3.eng: “Reverend, there are these three states of existence.

sn38.13:1.4.eng: Existence in the sensual realm, the realm of luminous form, and the formless realm.

sn38.13:1.5.eng: These are the three states of existence.”

sn38.13:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etesaṃ bhavānaṃ pariññāyā”ti?
sn38.13:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three states of existence?”

sn38.13:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etesaṃ bhavānaṃ pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.13:1.8.pli: “Katamo, panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etesaṃ bhavānaṃ pariññāyā”ti?

sn38.13:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etesaṃ bhavānaṃ pariññāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.13:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etesaṃ bhavānaṃ pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.13:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etesaṃ bhavānaṃ pariññāya.

sn38.14:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘suffering’.

sn38.14:1.3.eng: “Reverend, there are these three forms of suffering.

sn38.14:1.4.eng: The suffering inherent in painful feeling; the suffering inherent in conditions; and the suffering inherent in perishing.

sn38.14:1.5.eng: These are the three forms of suffering.”

sn38.14:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṃ dukkhatānaṃ pariññāyā”ti?
sn38.14:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these forms of suffering?”

sn38.14:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṃ dukkhatānaṃ pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.14:1.8.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etāsaṃ dukkhatānaṃ pariññāyā”ti?

sn38.14:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etāsaṃ dukkhatānaṃ pariññāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.14:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etāsaṃ dukkhatānaṃ pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.14:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etāsaṃ dukkhatānaṃ pariññāya.

sn38.15:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘substantial reality’.

sn38.15:1.3.pli: “Pañcime, āvuso, upādānakkhandhā sakkāyo vutto bhagavatā, seyyathidaṃ—
sn38.15:1.3.eng: “Reverend, the Buddha said that these five grasping aggregates are substantial reality. That is,

sn38.15:1.4.eng: form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

sn38.15:1.5.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, pañcupādānakkhandhā sakkāyo vutto bhagavatā”ti.
sn38.15:1.5.eng: The Buddha said that these five grasping aggregates are substantial reality.”

sn38.15:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti?
sn38.15:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding this substantial reality?”

sn38.15:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.15:1.8.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti?

sn38.15:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.15:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.15:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya.

sn38.16:0.3.eng: A Question About What’s Hard to Do

sn38.16:1.1.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye dukkaran”ti?
sn38.16:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, in this teaching and training, what is hard to do?”

sn38.16:1.2.eng: “Going forth, reverend, is hard to do in this teaching and training.”

sn38.16:1.3.eng: “But what’s hard to do for someone who has gone forth?”

sn38.16:1.4.eng: “When you’ve gone forth it’s hard to be satisfied.”

sn38.16:1.5.eng: “But what’s hard to do for someone who is satisfied?”

sn38.16:1.6.eng: “When you’re satisfied, it’s hard to practice in line with the teaching.”

sn38.16:1.7.eng: “But if a mendicant practices in line with the teaching, will it take them long to become a perfected one?”

sn38.16:1.10.eng: The Linked Discourses with Jambukhādaka are complete.

sn38.2:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘perfection’.

sn38.2:1.3.eng: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion

sn38.2:1.5.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
sn38.2:1.5.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this perfection?”

sn38.2:1.6.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

sn38.2:1.7.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?

sn38.2:1.8.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṃ—
sn38.2:1.8.eng: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

sn38.2:1.9.eng: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

sn38.2:1.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo, ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
sn38.2:1.10.eng: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this perfection.”

sn38.2:1.11.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya.
sn38.2:1.11.eng: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this perfection.

sn38.2:1.12.eng: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”

sn38.3:1.1.pli: “Ke nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, loke dhammavādino, ke loke suppaṭipannā, ke loke sugatā”ti?
sn38.3:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, who in the world have principled speech? Who in the world practice well? Who are the Holy Ones in the world?”

sn38.3:1.2.pli: “Ye kho, āvuso, rāgappahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, dosappahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, mohappahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, te loke dhammavādino.
sn38.3:1.2.eng: “Reverend, those who teach principles for giving up greed, hate, and delusion have principled speech in the world.

sn38.3:1.3.pli: Ye kho, āvuso, rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā, dosassa pahānāya paṭipannā, mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā, te loke suppaṭipannā.
sn38.3:1.3.eng: Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well in the world.

sn38.3:1.4.pli: Yesaṃ kho, āvuso, rāgo pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, doso pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, moho pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, te loke sugatā”ti.
sn38.3:1.4.eng: Those who have given up greed, hate, and delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future—are Holy Ones in the world.”

sn38.3:2.1.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti?
sn38.3:2.1.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion?”

sn38.3:2.2.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.3:2.3.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti?

sn38.3:2.4.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya, seyyathidaṃ—
sn38.3:2.4.eng: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

sn38.3:2.5.eng: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

sn38.3:2.6.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti.
sn38.3:2.6.eng: This is the path, this is the practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.”

sn38.3:2.7.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya.
sn38.3:2.7.eng: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.

sn38.3:2.8.eng: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”

sn38.4:1.1.pli: “Kimatthiyaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, samaṇe gotame brahmacariyaṃ vussatī”ti?
sn38.4:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, what’s the purpose of leading the spiritual life under the ascetic Gotama?”

sn38.4:1.2.pli: “Dukkhassa kho, āvuso, pariññatthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī”ti.
sn38.4:1.2.eng: “The purpose of leading the spiritual life under the Buddha is to completely understand suffering.”

sn38.4:1.3.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa dukkhassa pariññāyā”ti?
sn38.4:1.3.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding this suffering?”

sn38.4:1.4.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa dukkhassa pariññāyā”ti?

sn38.4:1.5.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etassa dukkhassa pariññāyā”ti?

sn38.4:2.1.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etassa dukkhassa pariññāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.4:2.3.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa dukkhassa pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.4:2.4.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa dukkhassa pariññāya.

sn38.5:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘gaining solace’.

sn38.5:1.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, assāsappatto hotī”ti?
sn38.5:1.2.eng: At what point do you gain solace?”

sn38.5:1.3.pli: “Yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhu channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ettāvatā kho, āvuso, assāsappatto hotī”ti.
sn38.5:1.3.eng: “When a mendicant truly understands the six fields of contact’s origin, disappearance, gratification, drawback, and escape, at that point they’ve gained solace.”

sn38.5:1.4.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
sn38.5:1.4.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this solace?”

sn38.5:1.5.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

sn38.5:1.6.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?

sn38.5:1.7.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.5:1.9.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

sn38.5:1.10.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāya.

sn38.6:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘gaining ultimate solace’.

sn38.6:1.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, paramassāsappatto hotī”ti?
sn38.6:1.2.eng: At what point do you gain ultimate solace?”

sn38.6:1.3.pli: “Yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhu channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā anupādāvimutto hoti, ettāvatā kho, āvuso, paramassāsappatto hotī”ti.
sn38.6:1.3.eng: “When a mendicant is freed by not grasping after truly understanding the six fields of contact’s origin, disappearance, gratification, drawback, and escape, at that point they’ve gained ultimate solace.”

sn38.6:1.4.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa paramassāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
sn38.6:1.4.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this ultimate solace?”

sn38.6:1.5.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa paramassāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

sn38.6:1.6.pli: “Katamo pana, āvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etassa paramassāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?

sn38.6:1.7.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa paramassāsassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.6:1.9.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etassa paramassāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

sn38.6:1.10.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa paramassāsassa sacchikiriyāya.

sn38.7:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘feeling’.

sn38.7:1.5.pli: Sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā—

sn38.7:1.7.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ pariññāyā”ti?
sn38.7:1.7.eng: “But reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three feelings?”

sn38.7:1.8.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.7:1.9.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etāsaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ pariññāyā”ti?

sn38.7:1.10.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etāsaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ pariññāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.7:1.12.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etāsaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ pariññāyā”ti.

sn38.7:1.13.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etāsaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ pariññāya.

sn38.8:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘defilement’.

sn38.8:1.4.eng: The defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.

sn38.8:1.6.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etesaṃ āsavānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?
sn38.8:1.6.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three defilements?”

sn38.8:1.7.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etesaṃ āsavānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.8:1.8.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etesaṃ āsavānaṃ pahānāyā”ti?

sn38.8:1.9.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etesaṃ āsavānaṃ pahānāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.8:1.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etesaṃ āsavānaṃ pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.8:1.12.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etesaṃ āsavānaṃ pahānāya.

sn38.9:1.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘ignorance’.

sn38.9:1.3.pli: “Yaṃ kho, āvuso, dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ—
sn38.9:1.3.eng: “Not knowing about suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.

sn38.9:1.5.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etissā avijjāya pahānāyā”ti?
sn38.9:1.5.eng: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up that ignorance?”

sn38.9:1.6.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etissā avijjāya pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.9:1.7.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etissā avijjāya pahānāyā”ti?

sn38.9:1.8.pli: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etissā avijjāya pahānāya, seyyathidaṃ—

sn38.9:1.10.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā, etissā avijjāya pahānāyā”ti.

sn38.9:1.11.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etissā avijjāya pahānāya.
